xbrli:xbrl.in-bse-fin:DisclosureOfNotesOnFinancialR: Gross non-performing assets represents gross customer assets Net non-performing assets represents net customer assets % of gross NPAs represents % of gross non-performing customer assets to gross customer assets % of net NPAs represents % of net non-performing customer assets to net customer assets
xbrli:xbrl.in-bse-fin:DisclosureOfNotesOnAssetsAndL: Reserves includes Employee Stock Option Reserves
xbrli:xbrl.in-bse-fin:DisclosureOfNotesOnSegmentsEx: As per Part A of Schedule IV ( refer regulation 33 (1) (e) ) of Securities and Exhange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, the listed entity shall ensure that segment reporting is done in accordance with AS-17 or Indian Accounting Standard 108 as applicable, specified in Section 133 of the Companies Act, 2013 read with relevant rules framed thereunder or by the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India, whichever is applicable. As per AS - 17, Segment Reporting, if a single financial report contains both consolidated financial statements and the separate financial statements of the parent, segment information need be presented only on the basis of the consolidated financial statements. In accordance with the above, since the financial results for H1-2023 includes both consolidated financial statements and standalone financial statements of ICICI Bank Limited, the Bank has included only consolidated segment results in stock exchange filings. Accordingly, for the purpose of validation of this documents, the values entered in this sheet are zero.
